title: Wine-Producing Equestrian Estate in California’s Napa Valley
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: Napa, California

Price: $18 million

Known as Toyon Farm, this 81-acre Napa Valley estate offers 30 acres of producing vineyards and a top-flight equestrian facility.

"Toyon Farm is the premier boarding and training equestrian facility in northern California," listing agent Cyd Greer said. "It’s quite well known in the equestrian community, built to the quality of the finer equestrian facilities in Europe."

The owner bought the property in 1993 and "made significant upgrades" to the existing horse boarding and training components of the farm, she said.

The equestrian facilities at Toyon Farm now comprise about 39,000 square feet of covered space and superior boarding facilities—including barns with nine grooming areas, three tack rooms, a state-of-the-art covered arena with a viewing lounge, and an indoor lunging ring—as well as an outdoor dressage arena, a large oval jumping ring, and a 66-foot lighted lunging ring. In addition, horseback riding trails wind throughout the vineyards.

More: Building on Mackinac Island, Where Horses Rule The Roads

Sited on west-facing slopes of the Carneros American Viticultural Area, Toyon Farm has a soil composition, coupled with adequate water from two irrigation ponds, that makes the land ideal for Pinot Noir and Chardonnay varietals. The vines on the farm produce premium grapes that are sold to a number of highly regarded wineries, including Ancien, Alpha Omega and Saintsbury.

Along with the existing 30 acres of vines, there are another 3.45 acres of plantable acres on the property.

"The setting is exquisite," Ms. Greer said. "It’s a very high-end neighborhood."

"The two ponds kind of anchor the site and they provide idyllic views," she said.

"You have beautiful layered views across your vineyard and the ponds and expansive views of other vineyards, with layered hills and mountains in the distance," Ms. Greer said.

More: Actor John Stamos Snaps up $5.75 Million House in California

Car commercials have been filmed on the property, she added. "The views are very expansive—you can see for miles and miles."

The 4,000-square-foot Old World-inspired main house was designed by Robert Keenan and built in 1989.

The style of the house works quite well with the equestrian facility, Ms. Greer said.

The interiors were redone by Marcel Sedletzky in 1994, she said. "He brought in some beautiful wood finishes and added a good deal of warmth to the house."

Other design details include high ceilings, polished concrete finishes, solid mahogany doors and an entry courtyard with a tiled fountain. The cathedral-ceilinged great room has a wet bar and opens to an al fresco dining area with a wood-burning fireplace and an idyllic view.

The property is "extremely private," Ms. Greer said. "You’ve got all of these great views, but you don’t see any other residences.

More: Historic Manor House With Polo Field and Tennis Court Asks £10 Million

Stats

The 4,000-square-foot house has three bedrooms, two full bathrooms and one partial bathroom. It sits on an 80.59-acre lot. There is also a 2,000-square-foot estate manager’s home with two bedrooms and two full bathrooms.

Amenities

A shady three-sided cabana overlooks the heated pool and hot tub. Other amenities include a temperature-controlled 5,500-bottle wine cellar and tasting room, a three-car garage, and a fireplace in the great room.

From Penta: Christie’s to Offer Art Collection of Ron Miller and Diane Disney Miller

Neighborhood Notes

The property is 10 minutes from downtown Napa and one hour from San Francisco, Ms. Greer said. "It’s secluded, yet close to town."

The luxury Carneros Resort and Spa is "quite close," she said. "You’re also not far from Sonoma—it’s just 10 or 15 minutes [to town]."

Agent: Cyd Greer, Coldwell Banker Brokers of the Valley
